org.horrabin.horrorss
Class RssChannelBean

java.lang.Object
  org.horrabin.horrorss.RssChannelBean
public class RssChannelBean
extends java.lang.Object

The RssChannelBean object represents the element channel in a RSS feed. Compatible with RSS 2.0, RDF and ATOM 0.3

Author:
Fernando Fornieles

Constructor Summary
RssChannelBean(int rssType)
          Create a new RssChannelBean.The rssType parameter tells to the parser the specification of the feed
If rssType=0 the feed is RDF If rssType=1 the feed is RSS 2.0 If rssType=2 the feed is ATOM 0.3

Constructor Detail

RssChannelBean

public RssChannelBean(int rssType)
Create a new RssChannelBean.The rssType parameter tells to the parser the specification of the feed
  • If rssType=0 the feed is RDF
  • If rssType=1 the feed is RSS 2.0
  • If rssType=2 the feed is ATOM 0.3

Parameters:
rssType - tells the parser which specification must use (RSS 2.0, RDF o ATOM)

RssChannelBean

public RssChannelBean(java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String link,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      int rssType)
Create a new RssChannelBean. The rssType parameter tells to the parser the specification of the feed
  • If rssType=0 the feed is RDF
  • If rssType=1 the feed is RSS 2.0
  • If rssType=2 the feed is ATOM

Parameters:
title - the title of the channel
link - the link channel's web page
description - the description of the channel
rssType - the type of the feed.

public void setRssType(int rssType)
Sets the RSS specification of the feed.
  • If rssType=0 the feed is RDF
  • If rssType=1 the feed is RSS 2.0
  • If rssType=2 the feed is ATOM 0.3

Parameters:

getRssType

public int getRssType()
Returns the RSS feed specification
  • If rssType=0 the feed is RDF
  • If rssType=1 the feed is RSS 2.0
  • If rssType=2 the feed is ATOM 0.3
